name: stupid meta deck
description: punitive counter scorch fast advance weeee, does this deck make sense to anyone?

name: Tag - you're it! 1.1
description:
Cut "Breaking News", "Plan B" and "Invasion of Privacy". Got the number of cards below 50 that way, but still feel the deck is not ideal.

Unfortunately I only have very few chances to test decks, as I only play rarely, and most of my musings are (unfortunately) theoretical...

Therefore, any comments as to playability etc. very appreciated...

name: Near Earth Hobo (aka Trust Fund Bum)
description:
NEH opens up a whole new style of Hobo play: the Diversified Portfolio Trust Fund Bum. Get a crap ton of servers installed while drawing through the deck. Diversified portfolio will make you rich when you need to be, but not before. The new thing here is that Diversified lets us to surprise the runner when they thought we were too poor for Biotic Labor and/or SanSan City Grid.

We all know and love the hobo classic Install > Trick of Light > Advance and Score with 2c. Now you can be poor all game and then go from 1c to X in a click, and Sansan or Biotic to your heart's content.

name: Deck for Alex
description: Futureproof - Indexing x3 Cyber Exodus - Test Run x3

name: The World is Yours.... is Yours.... is Yours.... is Yours...

description: Cyber Exodus - Pop-up Window x2 - Project Vitruvius x3 Future Proof - Eli 1.0 x3

name: Ronin Warriors
One Break
description:
The idea here is simple--you can save money and make the corp waste money by only using one icebreaker. This is possible due to paintbrush, which will trade clicks to make more efficient runs. The best icebreaker for this is Gordian Blade--it's in-faction, keeps strength for the entire run, and is relatively cheap to get up and running.

Having made this decision (foolishly?) the rest of the deck is based around having a lot of other possibilities for getting programs (both tutoring through Self-Modifying Code and Test Run, and recursion through Clone Chips and Ar Levy Access). This does a few things: first, it allows you to run only one copy of Gordian Blade, since it effectively has 7x copies when searching for it the first time, and four copies that the corp must trash to stall you out--something that will be difficult to do since you will not face-check anything you can't break thanks to paintbrush. Similarly, the two copies of Replicator make this deck FAR smaller than it appears, since you can go and get the second copy of anything you want after it's installed, making it a smaller deck than it appears.

Having provided a way to both get and retain the two crucial tools--Gordian Blade + Paintbrush--the deck has two other main supports: 1) making runs cheaper, and 2) making runs more profitable.

Making runs cheaper is seen through the obvious: two data suckers and 3x personal touches. Each of these provides huge dividends over the course of the game. Similarly, the choice to run The Toolbox also gives clickless, recurring credits to fuel the one large run each turn, given even if the corp somehow gets 3x thick, non-code gate ice. To help facilitate this not happening, hold Escher in your hand to re-arrange ice where ever needed--this is huge as it can save you multiple clicks per turn.

Pressure comes through HQ Interface (looking at 4x cards per is awesome), Indexing, R&D Interface, and Keyhole. These combined together provide pressure to both HQ and RnD, giving two very easy ways to provide pressure and keep the Corp from defending the remote servers too heavily, allowing for easier snipes.

Economy comes from the obvious: clickless econ from daily casts, the awesome kati, and the no brainer Sure Gamble. The additional econ comes from Professional Contacts if you need to dig deep, otherwise card draw + econ comes from Motivation + Oracle May, or Post-Test Run + Oracle May--getting a card + 2 credits is huge.

This deck hates being tagged, so be careful of that. It may need some plascretes or something else thrown in, but you should be rich enough to beat traces if you play this right--remember, most runs will be free!

name: Weyland Pay to Win 2.0
description:
Continuing the long tradition of Pay To Win Weyland, I've updated the list to include lotus field to combat datasucker users. This variant doesn't care to kill the runner at all, but rather snap off their breakers and go to town.

If you don't like the tons of ice, I recommend 2 power shutdown and 1 cyberdex trial to really clean the clock on the douchbaggy datasucker players. To do this drop 2 guard and 1 hive.

If you like a kill option, add 3 punitive counterstrike to the list in place of those above. Mo Money, Mo problems.

A great deck for a friend if all your jackson's are in your primary deck too.

name: Stronger Together?
description: First attempt at making a deck but seems pretty thick but I'm not sure how to go about narrowing it down

name: RP Tag punishment
description: The goal is to force the runner to spend as many extra clicks per turn as possible: mandatory central run for RP, drawing cards after taking net damage, removing tags, gaining credits after hitting tollbooth or a closed accounts, which should generate scoring windows and keep them off balance.

name: Shaper Kate

name: NBN 1st build
description: 1st deck build, Core set exclusive

name: Fixed Engineering
description:
Playing a LOT of Nasir there are a few things I've come to understand about his needs:

1) he usually can't steal NAPD and sometimes not even an Evil Baby, so he needs Imp or Demo Run. 2) he needs a cheap and easy way to beat Pop-up Window. 3) he needs a way to zap ICE strength, and ICE destruction is desirable. 4) he needs late-game money after he's got most ICE rezzed so he can make economical runs. He also needs that money to be ready anytime and fast. 5) he usually can't beat a trace, so resources are sketchy in general. Relying on Kati Jones for late game resources is like pushing your luck imo. But Kati is a good option for Nasir.

This deck aims to satisfy most of these. The only problem I have ignored in this is ICE destruction, which I find to be inessential if you're going Anarch suite + Atman at 4 + Opus. I've opted for Modded which can help install some of the 15 cards available, some of which you might need in a pinch. Easy Mark solves one of his other problems: starting a turn with no cred. I don't like taking brain damage via Stimhack, and Easy Mark is the substitution. It also brings you up to 3 cred from 0, which is what nearly every breaker in the deck costs.

I've been using Armitage Codebusting in every Nasir build, and it's been excellent. Armitage is a pre-Opus Opus so you can get the necessary stuff out. I've never NOT wanted it. I am not a fan of Kati with Nasir because she's far too slow, and you can Test Run/SMC Opus.

Some card choices:

Akamatsu over Solutions. It's cheaper, and you'll build your rig slowly, not all at once (because no Stimhack).

Quality Time over Diesel. Generally, if I'm drawing, I'm digging for a solution or I am trying to avoid taking a lot of net damage.

Corroder over Inti. Inti is the 46th card. I like Inti, but couldn't justify keeping it in when I have the best barrier breaker in the game already. And most of the barrier ICE you'll facecheck can be broken with Corroder anyway.

No Scavenge. This was my last cut from the deck to free room for Clone Chip. Clone Chip just does so much more for this deck. Recurring Imps is huge, and it allows me to do so during a run. I won't have a way to Scavenge Femme, but I can always trash it and then Test Run it, if it comes down to that.

Just 1 Atman. Atman is usually going to go at 4 unless you know what you're playing against.

No Parasite. I find that I need my SMCs and Test Runs for breakers more than Parasites, though I wouldn't fault anyone for running 1 Parasite just in case. The argument For Parasite is that it keeps the ICE layers lower, meaning you're less likely to get blown out by something tiny. I think that once you get Mimic and Yog.0 out, you need Parasite less.

Comments are very welcome!

name: NEH Psychobeale 2.1
Burning Moon v1.5
Sterling Connections
description:
I play this deck super slow, but I've had fun with it and it screws with people in my meta. Basically, a bit of econ events and straight resources... almost all connections! Most wins are through DLR > Archive blitz at game point using Crypsis.

Crash Space for anti-Punitive Counterstrike. Never worried about SE with Decoy and City Hall.

Fall Guys save the Source, City hall, DLR. People also forget he can give you money. Get Mr Li out ASAP. Helpful AI & Underworld Contacts for drip econ, all Hostage-able Data Dealer has been wrecking with so many Shi.kyu and Domestic Sleepers in my area.

I honestly don't think Account Siphons have a place in this deck. I did have two Inside Jobs. I might go with Leg Works for the mid-game when those agendas might be bunched up in HQ.

name: Iain's Extortion Racket
description: I'm still determined to make this work! Focus on either R&D or HQ depending on who you're playing against and what you have, try and score an early agenda, and then sacrifice it with Frame Job. Then Blackmail your way into remotes or into a low-defense central (then sacrifice the bank job to get paid for it!). Recur that Blackmail with SOT, but use them strategically. The Underworld Contacts/Gobalsec package I think will be very useful against SEA Source/Scorched and NBN's ice. Plus the drip economy will help.

name: Kit Peddler, Aggressive Cryptographer (v0.92)
Stirlock
description: Donut/Source/Fall Guy/Siphon/New Angeles/SOT disruption package, keyhole to set up a win in archives or further disrupt their econ/strategy. Singular running interference as a finisher for the game winning archives access.

name: Noise - Schehexually Transmitted Diseases v0.5
description: All in

name: Cerebral overwriting with mandatory upgrades.
description: Any comments are very welcome. This is a typical mandatory upgrades mushin deck. I just love mind games and do you really want to run my 4 advanced card? 1 card for the rest of the game hurts, you know. If i can score a mandatory upgrades the rest of the game is a piece of cake.

name: Psycho... Ares?
description: I know that everyone thinks you should just win with a beale instead, but this in't intended as a competitive deck. It is intended as a ridiculous combo that will work half the time, but devastate the runner when it triggers. Any comments (aside from play midseason phycho in nbn) are welcome.

name: Sea Scorch Brain Damage: In Haas Bioroid
description: A typical custom biotics sea scorch deck. Comments are welcome.

name: Andy's a bit simple.
description: Gradually refining my Andromeda deck and having a lot of fun with it.

name: The Most Efficient Rig In The West (Stealth CT)
description:
The Rig

  • 1x BlacKat
  • 1x Refractor
  • 1x Dagger
  • 2x Cloak
  • 1x Magnum Opus
  • As many sources of recurring credits as possible

Why?

Because you're getting in anywhere, every turn, for close to free. If the corp starts stacking one type of ice on a server, just Escher and rearrange (dropping a Ghost Runner if necessary). Or pull Gordian/Inti/Pipeline out of your pocket and install that.

What else?

This could totally work in Nasir with +3x Personal Workshop +2x Mem Chips (maybe swapping Maker's Eyes for R&D Interfaces). Not sure how it would react to the credit resets but I bet it would be just fine.

Disclaimer

Haven't tested this. It might fall flat on its face. It might not.

The Future

Shaper stealth console when?

Why no Plascrete?

I forgot. Also you should be rich. Take 8 more and you're pretty safe from meat damage kills.

name: Wizard Takes King's Bishop
description:
Have not tested yet (will do it when next the group gets together to play).

NOTE: Any feedback will be appreciated. (first deck I have put together and not net-decked)

So the focus is on the Central Servers, namely R&D and HQ.

Ice Carver, Bishop, and Datasucker are there to bring down any ice's strength so that you won't need to actually pump up your breakers if you don't need to. Instead save money and just break subroutines with money.

Special Order, Test Run, and Djinn are your "Tutor" Cards for getting what you need out on the board when you need it.

Several Installs/retrieval from heap cards to keep your chess pieces in play.

Deep Red Because... ya, Caissa programs.

Xanadu and Rook to hurt the crops economy.

And Scrubber just so you can have a free 5 credit trash with Wizard's ability each turn.

My main concerns would be Economy. (Without testing) I am not sure that it has all that it needs money-wise to keep it afloat. Any suggestions on econ cards or cards that should be switched out I would like to know what you think in the comments.

name: Weyland Control
